method.name: GET
method.doc:
The Yahoo! Travel Trip Search service enables your applications to use a Yahoo! API to search for public trip plans that were created with the Yahoo! Travel Trip Planner at http://travel.yahoo.com/trip. With this web service you can get a list of trip plans by specifying keywords to be found in the title, description, or tags of matching plans.
To use this service, you need an application ID to identify your application. For more informaton on application IDs, see "What is An Application ID?" at http://developer.yahoo.com/faq/index.html#token.
For more information on the tripSearch request URL and the response for developers, see http://developer.yahoo.com/travel/tripservice/V1/tripSearch.html.

param.name: appid
param.doc: The application ID. For more information, see "What is an Application ID?" at http://developer.yahoo.com/faq/index.html#token .

param.name: query
param.doc: Search keyword(s). Returns public trip plans containing the keywords in the trip plans' title, description, or tags.

param.name: results
param.doc: The number of trip plans to return. The default value is 10, and the maximum allowed number is 50.

param.name: start
param.doc: The result from which to start the block of trip plan results. By default the results start from 1.

param.name: output
param.doc: The output format. The default is xml. You can also specify json or php. XML format is described at http://developer.yahoo.com/travel/tripservice/V1/tripSearch.html . JSON format is described at http://developer.yahoo.com/common/json.html . Serialized PHP format is described at http://developer.yahoo.com/common/phpserial.html

param.name: callback
param.doc:
If JSON is the output format, this parameter specifies the name of the callback function to wrap around the JSON data. The following characters are allowed in the function name: A-Z a-z 0-9 . [] _
If JSON hasn't been specified as the output, this parameter is ignored. For more information on callbacks, see http://developer.yahoo.net/common/json.html#callbackparam

method.name: GET
method.doc:
The Yahoo! Travel Get Trip service enables your application to use a Yahoo! API to get detailed information about a trip that were created with the Yahoo! Travel Trip Planner at http://travel.yahoo.com/trip.
With this web service you can get information about a public trip plan including its description, destinations and all the items associated with that trip.
To use this service, you need an application ID to identify your application and the ID of the trip plan you want to retrieve. For more informaton on application IDs, see "What is An Application ID?" at http://developer.yahoo.com/faq/index.html#token. To find the ID of the trip plan, use the Yahoo! Travel Trip Search service.

param.name: appid
param.doc: The application ID. For more information, see "What is an Application ID?" at http://developer.yahoo.com/faq/index.html#token.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the trip plan, created with the Yahoo! Travel Trip Planner, that you want to retrieve. You can find out the ID of the trip you want to find using the Yahoo! Travel Trip Search service.

param.name: output
param.doc: The output format. The default is xml. You can also specify json or php. XML format is described at http://developer.yahoo.com/travel/tripservice/V1/tripSearch.html . JSON format is described at http://developer.yahoo.com/common/json.html . Serialized PHP format is described at http://developer.yahoo.com/common/phpserial.html

param.name: callback
param.doc:
If JSON is the output format, this parameter specifies the name of the callback function to wrap around the JSON data. The following characters are allowed in the function name: A-Z a-z 0-9 . [] _
If JSON hasn't been specified as the output, this parameter is ignored. For more information on callbacks, see http://developer.yahoo.net/common/json.html#callbackparam
